meanings.definition: A visual image that persists after the stimulus causing it has ceased.
meanings.sent1: After staring at the bright light, I saw an afterimage of the sun when I closed my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The afterimage of the fireworks lingered in my vision even after they had disappeared from the sky.
meanings.sent3: The afterimage of the banana made me feel like I had a fruity ghost following me around.
meanings.sent4: The afterimage of the lightning bolt was etched in my mind like a fleeting memory.
meanings.sent5: The afterimage of the rainbow painted a vivid spectrum in my sight.

meanings.definition: A visual sensation that remains after a stimulus is removed.
meanings.sent1: The afterimage of the flashlight stayed in my vision for a few seconds after it was turned off.
meanings.sent2: She blinked repeatedly to try and get rid of the afterimage of the camera flash.
meanings.sent3: The afterimage of the cat's eyes made me think it was still staring at me even though it had left the room.
meanings.sent4: The afterimage of the shooting star left a trail of light in the darkness of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The afterimage of the neon sign burned brightly in my mind's eye.
